intro: Cinnamomum rupestre, commonly known as the rock cinnamon, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces dark brown, aromatic berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its medicinal and aromatic properties, it is valued in traditional herbal practices.
